ratings.comment: Mary's was probably one of my favorite lecturers in my first sem. She genuinely cares about her students and wants us to do well. Complete all your assignments on time (ahead of time too) and talk to here whenever you have questions. She gives valuable feedback and as long as you fulfill it, you'll do great.

Taking Mary's ESL116 is probably my best decision in freshman year. She is very caring and teaches in a relatively casual way. She is a little tough grading the tests, but she gives fantastic office hours. Talk to her after class and you will definitely learn a lot. She allows me to jump to 118 after this semester. I appreciate that.

She has interesting lectures. Mary gives detailed and helpful feedback on every homework. This course is time demanding and not an easy A class. But it is hard to get A if you finish all homework carefully. Try her class if you really want to improve your writing skill.

I'm a freshman in her ESL 118 class, I dropped another class for this, it was worth it. Mary is skilled, she cares about her students very much. All the students in her class became close friends at the end of semester. The workload is hard, don't overdue the assignments, and she gives detailed feedback and careful instructions.

To be honest, I wanted to drop this class in the first month, because all of my grades were lower than 70. But after I talked to her, I just felt that I can be better in this class. And now, I have already pass this class. I can feel that I have made a huge progress in writing papers. If you want to learn something, do TAKE Mary's class!

She is such a nice lady, very very helpful! She is willing to help you get used to the study and life here and knows her students well. Also, she corrects papers very carefully, yes, VERY detailed and thorough, and wants to help you success. Overall, she  is very easygoing and friendly. If you put efforts in this class, you will be good.

Seriously I don't know why would anyone think she is a good teacher. She is such a tough grader. It is the strangest class I have ever taken. I wouldn't recommend her class at all. Just drop the class if possible.

Mary is one of the best ESL instructors. Very helpful and willing to discuss ur paper with you detailedly. Provide some great ideas for u to start ur paper! Some students may tell you that her grading is harsh, and try ur best to keep away from her. But that's not the truth! Your scores will be great if you put a lot of energy in your papers.

She is a really really nice and patient lady. She is always here to help and you can tell that she really cares about students. ESL118 requires a lot of work but she does not make the class arose. Take her if it is possible.
she is a good teacher?but sometimes give us confusing guide

She is the best and most passionate professor I ever had. I developed my writing skills a lot during this class. Make sure to talk to her and have a good dialogue so you are on the same page with everything with for instance the topic for IRP. It will help you in the end, trust me! She will be very helpful if you ask her. Make sure to do the work.
Very nice lady, intensive course though. She is quite helpful and it's comfortable to attend her class. If you work hard, you will get a nice score in Mary's class. Best ESL teacher ever met!

Mary is one of my favorite teachers I have had throughout my four years of college. She can be tough in terms of assignments, but all you have to do is talk to her, she is always willing to help. She did ask to get things done ahead of other 118 classes, but felt fortunate that she did because I could avoid cramming them with all my other classes.

She is very helpful and willing to help students anytime. But she is very strict and have higher expectations compared to other instructors so it is not easy to get an A, easier for an AB. If you want to go to business school and need this class, you would be better off taking it with someone else.

Her class is not easy but she is ABSOLUTELY one of the best teacher I ever had! Course is very helpful to me. Don't panic when u got a awful grade in ur summaries or notes in the beginning of the class. U will grow to fit her expectation in ur writing, and then u r gonna get a decent grade for 118!

This class requires A LOT but mary is very helpful. She makes a lot of comments on the papers so you know how to improve. But she is also very picky too. need to figure out what she likes and what she doesn't like on the paper. IRP pick familiar topic !!!!never ever ever take 18 credits with this course!!!!

She is a tough teacher, quite strict with the deadlines. But if you go through all of this, you'd find that her class is extremely helpful. She pays more attention than any other instructors. You will get very useful suggestions about ur paper.

She is tough, but responsible. She's always ready to help students, so if you are sured to get great scores as long as you study hard, that is irrelevant to how high your IQ is. While she's tough on your first 2 papers, she'll become extremely generous on your last paper, which takes up 50% of your total score!
